info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 12 at 4:41PM EDT until August 12 at 5:45PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Madison County in western North Carolina... North central Buncombe County in western North Carolina... * Until 545 PM EDT. * At 441 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 8 miles southwest of Greeneville to 14 miles west of Marshall, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Marshall, Mars Hill, Hot Springs, Faust, Allenstand, Walnut, Wolf Ridge, Barnardsville, Spring Creek and Flat Creek. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
